name: PubmedData
description: Contains additional metadata that is not otherwise captured in journal article, i.e. <PubMedArticle>, citations. These elements typically include details regarding the item's publication history, publication status, article identifiers, and references (if supplied by the publisher).

fields.name: History
fields.description: Lists dates associated with either the publication's publishing process history, as supplied by the publisher (e.g. received, accepted) or its citation's processing at NLM (e.g. entrez, pmc-release, and medline). See <PubMedPubDate> and @PubStatus attribute for more details.

fields.name: PubMedPubDate
fields.description: Includes additional dates associated with the publications. The type of date is designated by the @PubStatus attribute. Some of the dates pertain to NLM processing, e.g. entrez, pmc-release, and medline. Other dates pertain to a publication's history, e.g. dates the publisher received and accepted the article.

fields.name: Minute
fields.description: Contains the numeric value for the minute in a date.

fields.name: Hour
fields.description: Contains the numeric value for the hour in a date.

fields.name: Day
fields.description: Contains the numeric value for the day in a date.

fields.name: Month
fields.description: Contains the value of the month in a date. It will be recorded as either the numeric value or the first three letters of the month's name.

fields.name: Year
fields.description: Contains the four digit numeric value of the year in a date.

fields.name: PubStatus
fields.description: Describes the type of date contained by <PubMedPubDate>.

fields.name: PublicationStatus
fields.description: Indicates the status of the publication, i.e. whether it is print published (ppublish), electronically published (epublish), or published ahead of print, as determined by the primary publication date.

fields.name: ArticleIdList
fields.description: Lists all the identifiers associated with the citation. These identifiers may be associated with the original publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id).

fields.name: IdType
fields.description: Identifies the type of article identifier.

fields.name: ObjectList
fields.description: Available to list additional metadata that is not otherwise captured in other elements.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The @Type attribute provides additional information on the source or sort of item described.

fields.name: Param
fields.description: Available to specify an aspect of the <Object> element. There may be one or more <Param> within a single <Object>; the nature of the <Param> contents is indicated by the @Name value.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Available to identify the type of contents stated in the <Param> element.

fields.name: ReferenceList
fields.description: List of bibliographic references for a document or document component.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Provides the full journal title, as recorded in the NLM cataloging data following the NLM serial title standardization. See <MedlineTA> for the NLM journal title abbreviation. <Title> element within a <ReferenceList> describes a section within the references list.

fields.name: Reference
fields.description: Contains an item in a bibliographic list consisting of a citation and reference identifiers.

fields.name: ArticleIdList
fields.description: Lists all the identifiers associated with the citation. These identifiers may be associated with the original publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id). Specifies the value of an article identifier, either an identifier associated with the orignal publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id).

fields.name: IdType
fields.description: Identifies the type of article identifier.

fields.name: Citation
fields.description: Bibliographic description of a work.

fields.name: ReferenceList
fields.description: List of bibliographic references for a document or document component.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Provides the full journal title, as recorded in the NLM cataloging data following the NLM serial title standardization. See <MedlineTA> for the NLM journal title abbreviation. <Title> element within a <ReferenceList> describes a section within the references list.

fields.name: Reference
fields.description: Contains an item in a bibliographic list consisting of a citation and reference identifiers.

fields.name: ArticleIdList
fields.description: Lists all the identifiers associated with the citation. These identifiers may be associated with the original publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id). Specifies the value of an article identifier, either an identifier associated with the orignal publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id).

fields.name: IdType
fields.description: Identifies the type of article identifier.

fields.name: Citation
fields.description: Bibliographic description of a work.

fields.name: ReferenceList
fields.description: List of bibliographic references for a document or document component.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Provides the full journal title, as recorded in the NLM cataloging data following the NLM serial title standardization. See <MedlineTA> for the NLM journal title abbreviation. <Title> element within a <ReferenceList> describes a section within the references list.

fields.name: Reference
fields.description: Contains an item in a bibliographic list consisting of a citation and reference identifiers.

fields.name: ArticleIdList
fields.description: Lists all the identifiers associated with the citation. These identifiers may be associated with the original publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id). Specifies the value of an article identifier, either an identifier associated with the orignal publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id).

fields.name: IdType
fields.description: Identifies the type of article identifier.

fields.name: Citation
fields.description: Bibliographic description of a work.

fields.name: ReferenceList
fields.description: List of bibliographic references for a document or document component.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Provides the full journal title, as recorded in the NLM cataloging data following the NLM serial title standardization. See <MedlineTA> for the NLM journal title abbreviation. <Title> element within a <ReferenceList> describes a section within the references list.

fields.name: Reference
fields.description: Contains an item in a bibliographic list consisting of a citation and reference identifiers.

fields.name: ArticleIdList
fields.description: Lists all the identifiers associated with the citation. These identifiers may be associated with the original publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id). Specifies the value of an article identifier, either an identifier associated with the orignal publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id).

fields.name: IdType
fields.description: Identifies the type of article identifier.

fields.name: Citation
fields.description: Bibliographic description of a work.

fields.name: ReferenceList
fields.description: List of bibliographic references for a document or document component.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Provides the full journal title, as recorded in the NLM cataloging data following the NLM serial title standardization. See <MedlineTA> for the NLM journal title abbreviation. <Title> element within a <ReferenceList> describes a section within the references list.

fields.name: Reference
fields.description: Contains an item in a bibliographic list consisting of a citation and reference identifiers.

fields.name: ArticleIdList
fields.description: Lists all the identifiers associated with the citation. These identifiers may be associated with the original publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id). Specifies the value of an article identifier, either an identifier associated with the orignal publication (e.g. DOI) or with the citation's processing at NLM (e.g. PMID or pubmed id).

fields.name: IdType
fields.description: Identifies the type of article identifier.

fields.name: Citation
fields.description: Bibliographic description of a work.

name: MedlineCitation
description: Contains the metadata to describe the published article, as well as additional metadata for data added to the citation by NLM, like the Medical Subject Headings (MeSH). It has a few attributes to indicate who created the citation, and how, when, or whether the citation was indexed for MEDLINE.

fields.name: PMID
fields.description: States the PubMed Identifier.

fields.name: Version
fields.description: Indicates the version number of the citation's PMID.

fields.name: DateCompleted
fields.description: Indicates the date NLM finished processing the citation for MEDLINE.

fields.name: Day
fields.description: Contains the numeric value for the day in a date.

fields.name: Month
fields.description: Contains the value of the month in a date. It will be recorded as either the numeric value or the first three letters of the month's name.

fields.name: Year
fields.description: Contains the four digit numeric value of the year in a date.

fields.name: DateRevised
fields.description: For article citations, it provides the date the citation was last updated. For book citations, it provides the date that a contribution to a book was last updated. A contribution is a part of a book authored by a person other than the book's author(s).

fields.name: Day
fields.description: Contains the numeric value for the day in a date.

fields.name: Month
fields.description: Contains the value of the month in a date. It will be recorded as either the numeric value or the first three letters of the month's name.

fields.name: Year
fields.description: Contains the four digit numeric value of the year in a date.

fields.name: Article
fields.description: Contains the metadata to describe one published article, including the journal issue, article title, author list, funding sources. It has an attribute, @PubModel, to indicate the medium in which the cited article is published.

fields.name: Journal
fields.description: Contains metadata identifying the journal in which the article was published.

fields.name: ISSN
fields.description: Indicates the International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) of the journal in which the article was published. The @IssnType attribute indicates whether the ISSN is the print ISSN or the electronic ISSN. A separate element, ISSNLinking indicates the linking ISSN.

fields.name: IssnType
fields.description: Identifies the type of ISSN, either electronic or print, contained by the <ISSN> element. A separate element, <ISSNLinking>, contains the linking ISSN.

fields.name: JournalIssue
fields.description: Contains metadata identifying the issue of the journal in which the article was published, as well as the version of the article, either online or print, from which the article was indexed.

fields.name: PubDate
fields.description: Contains a publication date associated with the publication.

fields.name: Season
fields.description: Contains the name of the season as used in the publication date.

fields.name: MedlineDate
fields.description: Contains the entire date string for a <PubDate> that does not fit the available date patterns: YYYY, YYYY + MM, YYYY + MM + DD, YYYY + SEASON.

fields.name: Day
fields.description: Contains the numeric value for the day in a date.

fields.name: Month
fields.description: Contains the value of the month in a date. It will be recorded as either the numeric value or the first three letters of the month's name.

fields.name: Year
fields.description: Contains the four digit numeric value of the year in a date.

fields.name: Volume
fields.description: Identifies the volume of the publication.

fields.name: Issue
fields.description: Identifies the issue, supplement, or part in which the article was published.

fields.name: CitedMedium
fields.description: Identifies the version of the article, either online or print, that was used by NLM to index the article during MEDLINE processing.

fields.name: ISOAbbreviation
fields.description: Contains the NLM version of the journal title ISO Abbreviation.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Provides the full journal title, as recorded in the NLM cataloging data following the NLM serial title standardization. See <MedlineTA> for the NLM journal title abbreviation. <Title> element within a <ReferenceList> describes a section within the references list.

fields.name: ArticleTitle
fields.description: Contains the title of the publication, in English, if published in English or translated to English in the publication.

fields.name: Pagination
fields.description: Includes the page numbers on which the publication referenced in the citation appears. The complete pagination for journal articles is stated within the <MedlinePgn> element. The complete pagination for books, book chapters, and other documents are stated in <StartPage> and <EndPage> elements. ELocationID is used in cases where pagination is not present.

fields.name: StartPage
fields.description: Specifies the first page of the publication cited. Applies to citations for books, book chapters, and other documents from the NCBI Bookshelf. <MedlinePgn> is used for journal article citations.

fields.name: EndPage
fields.description: Specifies the last page of the publication cited. Applies to citations for books, book chapters, and other documents from the NCBI Bookshelf. <MedlinePgn> is used for journal article citations.

fields.name: MedlinePgn
fields.description: Specifies the page numbers for the published journal article. The page numbers are inclusive, indicating the first through last page on which the article appeared.

fields.name: ELocationID
fields.description: Defined for use in 2008, <ELocationID> provides an electronic location for items which lack standard page numbers. It may reside on records either in lieu of Pagination or in addition to the Pagination element. It will always be present for publications that do not have standard page numbers.

fields.name: ValidYN
fields.description: Indicates whether the value is correct or not. The default value is 'Y'. On some older citations, if an incorrect value was initially provided and later corrected, the incorrect value may be retained and marked as ValidYN='N'. However, it is no longer used when citations are corrected; the incorrect values are now removed from the citation.

fields.name: EIdType
fields.description: Specifies the type of electronic location identifier.

fields.name: Abstract
fields.description: English-language abstracts are as supplied by the publisher or taken directly from the published article. If the article does not have a published abstract, NLM does not create one. However, in the absence of a formally labeled abstract in the published article, text from a substantive 'summary', 'summary and conclusions',or 'conclusions and summary' may be used.

fields.name: CopyrightInformation
fields.description: Introduced in 1999, this element includes copyright statement information associated with the publication's abstract or summary. Publishers or authors may still claim copyright on abstracts in records lacking <CopyrightInformation>. See <Abstract> for more copyright-related information.

fields.name: AbstractText
fields.description: Contains the text of the abstract or summary associated with the publication.

fields.name: AuthorListCompleteYN
fields.description: Indicates whether the list of values is intentionally incomplete, reflecting periods of time when NLM policy was to enter fewer than all items qualified. 'Y' indicates that the list of values is complete. 'N' indicates that the list of values is incomplete.

fields.name: AuthorListType
fields.description: The @Type attribute provides additional information on the source or sort of item described.

fields.name: AuthorList
fields.description: Lists contributors associated with the publication. For book citations, the contributors may be authors or editors. For journal article citations, the contributors will only be authors.

fields.name: CollectiveName
fields.description: Contains the name of a group contributor.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Contains the suffix associated with an individual's name, e.g. 'Jr' and 'IV'.

fields.name: Initials
fields.description: Contains the initials for an individual contributor's <ForeName>. Initials are generated automatically using an algorithm but may be modified by the publisher. Publishers may also submit initials with their article XML. Hyphens are allowed.

fields.name: ForeName
fields.description: Includes the first portion of an individual contributor's name, i.e. the author or investigator's first and middle names. The <Suffix>, <Initials>, and <LastName> are contained in separate elements. Prior to 2002 NLM did not enter full first or middle names; only initials were entered.

fields.name: LastName
fields.description: Contains the last name or the single name of an individual contributor, even if that single name is not considered to be a surname.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Introduced with the 2010 DTD, specifies a unique identifier for an individual contributor's name or affiliation, if available.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: When used in the <Identifer> element, it designates the organizational authority that established the unique identifier, e.g. ORCID or International Standard Name Identifier (ISNI). When used in the <OtherID> element, it identifies the source of the additional identifier associated with the record.

fields.name: EqualContrib
fields.description: Added to <Author> with the 2017 DTD, EqualContrib indicates whether one or more contributors contributed equally to the publication.

fields.name: AffiliationInfo
fields.description: Introduced in 2015, <AffiliationInfo> contains the <Affiliation> element with the institutional affiliation information for an author or investigator at the time of publication. It may also contain the <Identifier> element with a unique identifier for the organization, if one is available. Multiple <AffiliationInfo> elements may be provided.

fields.name: Affiliation
fields.description: Contains the institutional affiliation information associated with an author or investigator at the time of publication.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Introduced with the 2010 DTD, specifies a unique identifier for an individual contributor's name or affiliation, if available.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: When used in the <Identifer> element, it designates the organizational authority that established the unique identifier, e.g. ORCID or International Standard Name Identifier (ISNI). When used in the <OtherID> element, it identifies the source of the additional identifier associated with the record.

fields.name: ValidYN
fields.description: Indicates whether the value is correct or not. The default value is 'Y'. On some older citations, if an incorrect value was initially provided and later corrected, the incorrect value may be retained and marked as ValidYN='N'. However, it is no longer used when citations are corrected; the incorrect values are now removed from the citation.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: Indicates the language in which the publication was published. When a single record contains more than one language value the <Language> elements will be listed in alphabetic order by the 3-letter language value.

fields.name: DataBankListCompleteYN
fields.description: Indicates whether the list of values is intentionally incomplete, reflecting periods of time when NLM policy was to enter fewer than all items qualified. 'Y' indicates that the list of values is complete. 'N' indicates that the list of values is incomplete.

fields.name: DataBankList
fields.description: Lists each databank and its accession number(s) associated with the publication.

fields.name: AccessionNumberList
fields.description: Lists the values of accession numbers for a databank. The databank is identified in the element, <DataBankName>.

fields.name: DataBankName
fields.description: Indicates the name of the databank associated with the publication.

fields.name: GrantListCompleteYN
fields.description: Indicates whether the list of values is intentionally incomplete, reflecting periods of time when NLM policy was to enter fewer than all items qualified. 'Y' indicates that the list of values is complete. 'N' indicates that the list of values is incomplete.

fields.name: GrantList
fields.description: Introduced in 1981, this element lists the grant information for grants associated with the publication.

fields.name: GrantID
fields.description: Specifies the research grant or contract number for the funding that supported the publication.

fields.name: Acronym
fields.description: Identifies the acronym associated with a grant.

fields.name: Agency
fields.description: Identifies the funding agency by either the institute's acronym or full name.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: When used in <Grant>, states the country wherein the funding agency is located. When used in <MedlineJournalInfo>, states the place of publication of the journal.

fields.name: PublicationTypeList
fields.description: Contains one or more publication types that describe the publication. States the publication type values that best describe the publication, using one of the values from NLM's controlled list. Records may contain more than one <PublicationType> that are listed in alphabetical order.

fields.name: UI
fields.description: States the unique MeSH identifier.

fields.name: VernacularTitle
fields.description: Contains the non-English title of a publication originally published in a non-English language. For Latin based alphabets only, though may include transliterated titles of non-Latin based alphabet titles. Titles translated into English are in <ArticleTitle> and enclosed in brackets.

fields.name: ArticleDate
fields.description: Contains the date an electronic version of the article was published. The @DateType will always be present and will always indicate 'Electronic'.

fields.name: Day
fields.description: Contains the numeric value for the day in a date.

fields.name: Month
fields.description: Contains the value of the month in a date. It will be recorded as either the numeric value or the first three letters of the month's name.

fields.name: Year
fields.description: Contains the four digit numeric value of the year in a date.

fields.name: DateType
fields.description: Indicates the type of publication date. When occuring with the <ArticleDate> element, it will always indicate 'Electronic'.

fields.name: PubModel
fields.description: Specifies the type of medium/media in which the article is published, based on the types of publication dates, i.e. print publication date and electronic publication date, provided by the publisher.

fields.name: MedlineJournalInfo
fields.description: Contains additional journal metadata, supplemental to the metadata in the Journal wrapper element. Some elements are particular to NLM records, as developed for MEDLINE journals, e.g. NLM ID and MEDLINE TA.

fields.name: NlmUniqueID
fields.description: Specifies the accession number, a unique identifier for the journal, as assigned to the journal's catalog record by NLM.

fields.name: ISSNLinking
fields.description: Indicates the linking ISSN of the journal in which the article was published. The element was defined in the 2008 DTD but was first added to records in the 2010 MEDLINE/PubMed baseline files.

fields.name: MedlineTA
fields.description: States the title abbreviation for the journal in which the article appeared. These title abbreviations are designated by NLM. See <Title> for the full journal title, or <ISOAbbreviation> for the standard ISO abbreviation.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: When used in <Grant>, states the country wherein the funding agency is located. When used in <MedlineJournalInfo>, states the place of publication of the journal.

fields.name: ChemicalList
fields.description: Lists chemical substances mentioned in the publication. Includes a chemical substance mentioned in the publication. The name of the substance and registry number will be provided.

fields.name: NameOfSubstance
fields.description: Provides the name of the chemical substance, alongside a MeSH unique identifier for names of chemical substances.

fields.name: UI
fields.description: States the unique MeSH identifier.

fields.name: RegistryNumber
fields.description: Contains the unique registry number for a chemical substance, as designated by either the Chemical Abstracts Service, Enzyme Nomenclature, or Food and Drug Administration's Unique Ingredient Identifiers. A zero value indicates that no registry number is available.

fields.name: SupplMeshList
fields.description: Lists Supplementary Concept Record (SCR) terms assigned to the citation as part of MeSH indexing. Identifies a Supplementary Concept Record (SCR) term assigned to the citation as part of MeSH indexing. The @Type attribute identifies the class of SCR, e.g. disease or protocol. The @UI attribute provides the unique identifier for the SCR.

fields.name: UI
fields.description: States the unique MeSH identifier.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The @Type attribute provides additional information on the source or sort of item described.

fields.name: CitationSubset
fields.description: States the subset(s) for which the MEDLINE record was created. Most citations are from journals indexed for MEDLINE as part of 'Index Medicus', indicated by the citation subset value 'IM'. A small percentage of records in PubMed are in the OLDMEDLINE subset, indicated by the citation subset value 'OM'.

fields.name: CommentsCorrectionsList
fields.description: Lists citations for other publications associated with the citation. These associated citations may be for comments or retractions, for instance. Contains the citation information for an associated publication such as an erratum, retraction, or expression of concern, and specifies the type of relationship between the associated publications with the RefType attribute. See the PubMed User Guide, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/help/#comment-correction, for additional information.

fields.name: PMID
fields.description: States the PubMed Identifier.

fields.name: Version
fields.description: Indicates the version number of the citation's PMID.

fields.name: RefSource
fields.description: Provides the reference string for the associated publication. It will typically follow the format: NLM Title Abbreviation. Publication Date; Volume(Issue):Pagination.

fields.name: RefType
fields.description: Indicates the type of association between the citation and another publication, as well as the direction of the associated, for instance a comment on another publication or a retraction of another publication.

fields.name: Note
fields.description: Includes any notes added alongside an associated citation's entry, e.g. regarding the data correction published in an associated erratum.

fields.name: GeneSymbolList
fields.description: Lists the GeneSymbols associated with the citation. Includes the symbol or abbreviated form of a gene name, as it was reported in the publication. This data was only added to citations from 1991 to 1995; it is no longer added to citations.

fields.name: MeshHeadingList
fields.description: Contains the list of Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) that were assigned to the citation by NLM Indexing. The most significant MeSH assignments in the list are designated with @MajorTopic='Y'. Specifies a Medical Subject Heading (MeSH) assigned to the citation by NLM Indexing. Each MeSH heading entry includes one descriptor (<DescriptorName>) and zero, one, or more qualifiers (<QualifierName>).

fields.name: DescriptorName
fields.dscription: Contains the main MeSH headings assigned by NLM. The presentation of <DescriptorName> is alphabetical.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The @Type attribute provides additional information on the source or sort of item described.

fields.name: UI
fields.description: States the unique MeSH identifier.

fields.name: MajorTopicYN
fields.description: Indicates whether or not the MeSH heading captures one of the more significant points in the publication.

fields.name: QualifierName
fields.description: Contains MeSH terms that help to qualify the scope of the main MeSH terms assigned as Descriptors, see <DescriptorName>. The <QualifierName> associated with a <DescriptorName> is in alphabetical order.

fields.name: UI
fields.description: States the unique MeSH identifier.

fields.name: MajorTopicYN
fields.description: Indicates whether or not the MeSH heading captures one of the more significant points in the publication.

fields.name: NumberOfReferences
fields.description: Indicates the number of bibliographic references listed in citations for the following publication types: review, consensus development conference, and meta-analysis. This data is not currently input; NLM ceased adding the number of references to citations in 2010.

fields.name: PersonalNameSubjectList
fields.description: Lists one or more individuals whose life or work is the subject of the publication. Identifies an individual whose life or work is the subject of the publication.

fields.name: Initials
fields.description: Contains the initials for an individual contributor's <ForeName>. Initials are generated automatically using an algorithm but may be modified by the publisher. Publishers may also submit initials with their article XML. Hyphens are allowed.

fields.name: ForeName
fields.description: Includes the first portion of an individual contributor's name, i.e. the author or investigator's first and middle names. The <Suffix>, <Initials>, and <LastName> are contained in separate elements. Prior to 2002 NLM did not enter full first or middle names; only initials were entered.

fields.name: LastName
fields.description: Contains the last name or the single name of an individual contributor, even if that single name is not considered to be a surname.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Contains the suffix associated with an individual's name, e.g. 'Jr' and 'IV'.

fields.name: OtherID
fields.description: Contains any additional identifiers associated with the record. Some are provided by the collaborating partner who created or contributed to the record. Others are provided by NLM. The source of the identifier is stated in the @Source attribute.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: When used in the <Identifer> element, it designates the organizational authority that established the unique identifier, e.g. ORCID or International Standard Name Identifier (ISNI). When used in the <OtherID> element, it identifies the source of the additional identifier associated with the record.

fields.name: OtherAbstract
fields.description: Includes an abstract that is published in a language other than English (as indicated by the @Language attribute) or a plain language summary (if the @Type attribute is 'plain-language-summary'). Some older citations may include an <OtherAbstract> containing an abstract created by a collaborating partner or other entity, typically for older articles that did not include abstracts when initially published.

fields.name: CopyrightInformation
fields.description: Introduced in 1999, this element includes copyright statement information associated with the publication's abstract or summary. Publishers or authors may still claim copyright on abstracts in records lacking <CopyrightInformation>. See <Abstract> for more copyright-related information.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: Introduced in 2013, specifies the language of the abstract included in the <OtherAbstract> element.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The @Type attribute provides additional information on the source or sort of item described.

fields.name: KeywordListOwner
fields.description: Specifies the party responsible fo creating the citation.

fields.name: KeywordList
fields.description: Lists the keywords associated with the publication. The @Owner attribute indicates the organization that contributed the keywords. Beginning in 2013, the <KeywordList> with Owner attribute 'NOTNLM' contains author keywords provided by the publisher. On OLDMEDLINE records, the <KeywordList> with Owner attribute 'NLM' contains the original subject headings from the old print indexes from which the citations were created. In the past, NLM collaborating data producer partners such as NASA also added <KeywordList> data. Contains a keyword associated with the publication, such as author keywords when supplied by publishers.

fields.name: MajorTopicYN
fields.description: Indicates whether or not the MeSH heading captures one of the more significant points in the publication.

fields.name: CoiStatement
fields.description: Includes the Conflict of Interest statement for the publication. This field was introduced in 2017.

fields.name: SpaceFlightMission
fields.description: Identifies the space flight mission name and/or number when results of research conducted in space are covered in a publication. This data resides on citations created by National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), one of NLM's collaborating MEDLINE data producers. In October 2005 NLM discontinued the practice of adding space flight mission names and/or numbers to MEDLINE citations. This change was prospective only; we did not remove data from existing citations.

fields.name: InvestigatorList
fields.description: Introduced in 2008, lists names of investigators (or collaborators) who contributed to the publication as a member of a collective/group author. It will only be included on the citation if a collective/group author is included in the author list. For records containing more than one collective/group author, <InvestigatorList> does not indicate to which group author each personal name belongs. Identifies an investigator (or collaborator) who contributed to the publication as a member of a collective/group author.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Contains the suffix associated with an individual's name, e.g. 'Jr' and 'IV'.

fields.name: Initials
fields.description: Contains the initials for an individual contributor's <ForeName>. Initials are generated automatically using an algorithm but may be modified by the publisher. Publishers may also submit initials with their article XML. Hyphens are allowed.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Introduced with the 2010 DTD, specifies a unique identifier for an individual contributor's name or affiliation, if available.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: When used in the <Identifer> element, it designates the organizational authority that established the unique identifier, e.g. ORCID or International Standard Name Identifier (ISNI). When used in the <OtherID> element, it identifies the source of the additional identifier associated with the record.

fields.name: ForeName
fields.description: Includes the first portion of an individual contributor's name, i.e. the author or investigator's first and middle names. The <Suffix>, <Initials>, and <LastName> are contained in separate elements. Prior to 2002 NLM did not enter full first or middle names; only initials were entered.

fields.name: LastName
fields.description: Contains the last name or the single name of an individual contributor, even if that single name is not considered to be a surname.

fields.name: AffiliationInfo
fields.description: Introduced in 2015, <AffiliationInfo> contains the <Affiliation> element with the institutional affiliation information for an author or investigator at the time of publication. It may also contain the <Identifier> element with a unique identifier for the organization, if one is available. Multiple <AffiliationInfo> elements may be provided.

fields.name: Affiliation
fields.description: Contains the institutional affiliation information associated with an author or investigator at the time of publication.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Introduced with the 2010 DTD, specifies a unique identifier for an individual contributor's name or affiliation, if available.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: When used in the <Identifer> element, it designates the organizational authority that established the unique identifier, e.g. ORCID or International Standard Name Identifier (ISNI). When used in the <OtherID> element, it identifies the source of the additional identifier associated with the record.

fields.name: ValidYN
fields.description: Indicates whether the value is correct or not. The default value is 'Y'. On some older citations, if an incorrect value was initially provided and later corrected, the incorrect value may be retained and marked as ValidYN='N'. However, it is no longer used when citations are corrected; the incorrect values are now removed from the citation.

fields.name: GeneralNote
fields.description: Contains supplemental or descriptive information added to the citation. The @Owner attribute will indicate the party that created the note.

fields.name: Owner
fields.description: Specifies the party responsible fo creating the citation.

fields.name: Owner
fields.description: Specifies the party responsible fo creating the citation.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Indicates the NLM processing status of the citation.

fields.name: VersionID
fields.description: States the version number of the citation.

fields.name: VersionDate
fields.description: Provides the date the version was published.

fields.name: IndexingMethod
fields.description: Introduced with the 2017 DTD, IndexingMethod specifies the method used to assign Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) to the citation.
